alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 03 at 2:23PM CST until February 03 at 3:15PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 315 PM CST. * At 223 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Millry to 5 miles northwest of Chatom to 5 miles northeast of Fruitdale, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jackson, Thomasville, Grove Hill, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, Millry, Fruitdale, Coffeeville and Fulton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
